intro: Biscutella subscaposa, commonly known as the narrowleaf biscuitroot, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant features slender, ascending stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in racemes, typical of the mustard family. Biscutella subscaposa is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in harsh conditions.
